Events.title: 58 BC - 50 BC | Conquest of Gaul
Events.description: Caesar started his invasion of Gaul that lasted 8 years from 58-50 BC. This campaign significantly expanded Roman territory and increased Caesar's power and influence.

Events.title: 52 BC | Battle of Alesia
Events.description: The Battle of Alesia in 52 BC was a decisive battle during Caesar's Gallic Wars. Julius Caesar's forces besieged the stronghold of Vercingetorix, leader of the Gallic tribes. The victory effectively ended major Gallic resistance to Roman rule.

Events.title: 53 BC | Death of Crassus
Events.description: Marcus Licinius Crassus, a member of the First Triumvirate, was killed during the Battle of Carrhae in 53 BC against the Parthians. His death destabilized the balance of power between Caesar and Pompey.

Events.title: 54 BC | Death of Julia, Caesar's Daughter
Events.description: Julia, the daughter of Julius Caesar and the wife of Pompey, died in childbirth in 54 BC. Her death weakened the political alliance between Caesar and Pompey.

Events.title: 49 BC - 45 BC | Caesar's Civil War
Events.description: Julius Caesar's conflict with Pompey and the Roman Senate erupted into civil war in 49 BC, culminating in Caesar's victory at the Battle of Pharsalus in 48 BC and the subsequent consolidation of his power.

Events.title: 48 BC | Battle of Pharsalus
Events.description: In 48 BC, Caesar defeated Pompey at the Battle of Pharsalus. This decisive victory solidified Caesar's control over Rome and forced Pompey to flee to Egypt, where he was later assassinated.

Events.title: 47 BC | Alexandrian War
Events.description: The Alexandrian War (48-47 BC) saw Caesar intervening in Egypt's civil conflict. His forces defeated those of Ptolemy XIII, establishing Cleopatra VII as the ruler of Egypt and forming a political and romantic alliance with her.

Events.title: 47 BC | Pontic War
Events.description: After the Alexandrian War, Caesar quickly dealt with Pharnaces II of Pontus in 47 BC. Caesar's swift victory in the Battle of Zela led to his famous phrase 'Veni, Vidi, Vici' (I came, I saw, I conquered).

Events.title: 46 BC | African Campaign
Events.description: In 46 BC, Caesar launched a campaign against the remaining Republican forces in North Africa. The decisive Battle of Thapsus ended the resistance of Metellus Scipio and Cato the Younger, further consolidating Caesar's power.

Events.title: 44 BC | Assassination of Julius Caesar
Events.description: On the Ides of March (March 15) 44 BC, Julius Caesar was assassinated by a group of senators led by Brutus and Cassius. His death marked a turning point in Roman history, leading to the end of the Roman Republic and the rise of the Roman Empire.
